column5: We always knew it... we just couldn't prove it.  http://www.nationalpost.com/life/health/Sorry+teetotalers+little+drinking+good+your+heart/4346517/story.html  So Alberta's got it right, where a senior can get a free 26'er of liquor every month under their health plan. Do they still do that?
I'm already there Bob !!!! I,ve spilled more down the front of my T-Shirt, than you've consumed in your whole life
It sure cured my broken heart a few times.
Great tune by a great band
And Charlie Sheen will live forever.
it's after 5, time to take my medicinal beers then...
LOL After hearing his speach on rock 95,ya, he will. He,s bigger the man above,,,,,,,,,,,,So he says.
you should have seen the look I got at the beer store when I handed the girl a note saying 'prescription, one case of beer'

I seen this many a time in hospitals and nursing homes...  2Oz ethyl per/os Q2H during waking hours on a RX med sheet.  Meaning.. 2 ounces of (Brandy,Whiskey,Tequilla,Vodka,Gin etc..) every 2 hours taken orally during waking hours. So long as provided by family or self.. and must be in a plastic bottle.  It's mostly prescribed to terminal alcoholics during their stay at the hospice or LTC facility.  *That's like a 26'er or more a day... but I'm glad that the province isn't paying for it.  Randy
Wow, i thought you would have been passed out by now.
Maybe without booze lots of us wouldn't be here.
it ain't BOQ with the group  no fish whistle's were harmed in this reply either...
